column1: Stays and residents at women's shelters by resident status, region of
residence, duration and time
Stays
Stays with children
Women
Children
The statistics relate to stays at women's shelters according to §109
of the Social Service Act. All women's shelters have reported and
approved data in 2023. In the statistics for 2023, 4 pct. of the
women and 9 pct. of the children are either anonymous or without a
valid social security number.
The number of children in the tables are calculated as the sum of
the given social security numbers of children in the data. The
variable "number of children" is also found in micro data.
Deviations between this variable and the sum of the social security
numbers of children can occur, for example, due to input errors in
the data that the women's shelters report. Debugging is currently not
done for this error type. Region of residence is the mother's region
of residence before she moved to the shelter in the entire table, and
the figures for children therefore show the number of children with a
mother with the relevant region of residence.
